title: Alleged rapists' lawyers could be asked for lines of inquiry into their victims' by prosecutors
text:
Police and prosecutors could ask alleged rapists’ lawyers for lines of inquiry into their victims that could throw up evidence to clear them under proposals from the Attorney General.

Geoffrey Cox has suggested prosecution and defence lawyers could engage at an earlier stage before a suspect is charged so “reasonable lines of inquiry pointing away from the suspect” could be identified and “taken into account when considering a charging decision.”

This could help prosecutors and police investigators identify search terms for data on mobile phones, computers and social media that could reveal “undermining material” enabling weak cases to be closed at an early stage.
